title: Exploring Human-Animal Relationships Through Interdisciplinary Experiential Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational awareness of social issues and practical experience in a specialized field
context.additional_context: Process where current practitioners explore animals' social roles and ethical issues from multidisciplinary perspectives, acquiring actionable insights applicable to real-life contexts through experiential activities

learning_goals: Learners can analyze animal-related social issues from perspectives of at least three academic disciplines (e.g., philosophy, ecology, law).
Learners can formulate and implement practical action plans to enhance animal welfare.
Learners can develop a systematic framework to evaluate ethical dilemmas arising from human-animal interactions.

resources: Virtual Animal Welfare Facility Exploration Module

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
